meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a vacuole.
meanings.sent1: The vacuolar membrane helps store nutrients in plant cells.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the vacuolar structure of the cell.
meanings.sent3: The vacuolar size was so big, it could fit a whole apple!
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt vacuolar, empty of any thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The vacuolar appearance of the room made it seem spacious and airy.

meanings.sent1: The vacuolar organelles play a crucial role in cellular processes.
meanings.sent2: The vacuolar content varied between different cell types.
meanings.sent3: The vacuolar presence in the room made it feel less cluttered.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a vacuolar look, as if lost in thought.
meanings.sent5: The vacuolar nature of the sponge allowed it to absorb water efficiently.
